com.sonyericsson.capuchin
Interface ExternalResourceHandler

public interface ExternalResourceHandler

This interface is used to load external resources that are referenced within the Flash content.

An implementation of this interface is registered when creating a FlashImage using FlashImage.createImage(InputStream, ExternalResourceHandler)

If no external resource handler is registered, these resources will be retrieved using the API own default implementation.

The default implementation handles external files (file:///), Internet resources (http://) and MIDlets resources (res://).

When using the default implementation, the paths to these external resources have to be absolute.

Code Example:

The ActionScript line in Flash: 
 ...
 loadMovie("file:///c:/pictures/products.swf",_root);
 ...
will result in a call to requestResource(FlashImage, String) with URI value "file:///c:/pictures/products.swf".

Method Summary
 void requestResource(FlashImage image, java.lang.String URI)
          This method is invoked when an external resource is required by the Flash content.
 

Method Detail

requestResource

void requestResource(FlashImage image,
                     java.lang.String URI)

This method is invoked when an external resource is required by the Flash content.

When the InputStream is available the implementation should call FlashImage.resourceAvailable(String, InputStream) method.

Parameters:
image - FlashImage from where the request to load the external resource is originated.
URI - the URI for the external resource.
